speaker: Chorus
text_entry: ACT I

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: PROLOGUE

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Good morrow, and well met. How have ye done

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Since last we saw in France?

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: I thank your grace,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Healthful; and ever since a fresh admirer

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Of what I saw there.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: An untimely ague

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Stay'd me a prisoner in my chamber when

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Those suns of glory, those two lights of men,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Met in the vale of Andren.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: 'Twixt Guynes and Arde:

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: I was then present, saw them salute on horseback;

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Beheld them, when they lighted, how they clung

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: In their embracement, as they grew together;

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Which had they, what four throned ones could have weigh'd

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Such a compounded one?

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: All the whole time

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: I was my chamber's prisoner.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Then you lost

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: The view of earthly glory: men might say,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Till this time pomp was single, but now married

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: To one above itself. Each following day

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Became the next day's master, till the last

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Made former wonders its. To-day the French,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: All clinquant, all in gold, like heathen gods,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Shone down the English; and, to-morrow, they

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Made Britain India: every man that stood

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Show'd like a mine. Their dwarfish pages were

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: As cherubins, all guilt: the madams too,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Not used to toil, did almost sweat to bear

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: The pride upon them, that their very labour

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Was to them as a painting: now this masque

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Was cried incomparable; and the ensuing night

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Made it a fool and beggar. The two kings,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Equal in lustre, were now best, now worst,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: As presence did present them; him in eye,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Still him in praise: and, being present both

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: 'Twas said they saw but one; and no discerner

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Durst wag his tongue in censure. When these suns--

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: For so they phrase 'em--by their heralds challenged

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: The noble spirits to arms, they did perform

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Beyond thought's compass; that former fabulous story,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Being now seen possible enough, got credit,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: That Bevis was believed.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: O, you go far.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: As I belong to worship and affect

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: In honour honesty, the tract of every thing

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Would by a good discourser lose some life,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Which action's self was tongue to. All was royal;

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: To the disposing of it nought rebell'd.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Order gave each thing view; the office did

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Distinctly his full function.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Who did guide,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: I mean, who set the body and the limbs

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Of this great sport together, as you guess?

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: One, certes, that promises no element

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: In such a business.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: I pray you, who, my lord?

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: All this was order'd by the good discretion

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Of the right reverend Cardinal of York.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: The devil speed him! no man's pie is freed

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: From his ambitious finger. What had he

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: To do in these fierce vanities? I wonder

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: That such a keech can with his very bulk

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Take up the rays o' the beneficial sun

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: And keep it from the earth.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Surely, sir,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: There's in him stuff that puts him to these ends;

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: For, being not propp'd by ancestry, whose grace

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Chalks successors their way, nor call'd upon

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: For high feats done to the crown; neither allied

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: For eminent assistants; but, spider-like,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Out of his self-drawing web, he gives us note,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: The force of his own merit makes his way

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: A gift that heaven gives for him, which buys

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: A place next to the king.

speaker: ABERGAVENNY
text_entry: I cannot tell

speaker: ABERGAVENNY
text_entry: What heaven hath given him,--let some graver eye

speaker: ABERGAVENNY
text_entry: Pierce into that; but I can see his pride

speaker: ABERGAVENNY
text_entry: Peep through each part of him: whence has he that,

speaker: ABERGAVENNY
text_entry: If not from hell? the devil is a niggard,

speaker: ABERGAVENNY
text_entry: Or has given all before, and he begins

speaker: ABERGAVENNY
text_entry: A new hell in himself.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Why the devil,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Upon this French going out, took he upon him,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Without the privity o' the king, to appoint

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Who should attend on him? He makes up the file

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Of all the gentry; for the most part such

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: To whom as great a charge as little honour

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: He meant to lay upon: and his own letter,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: The honourable board of council out,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Must fetch him in the papers.

speaker: ABERGAVENNY
text_entry: I do know

speaker: ABERGAVENNY
text_entry: Kinsmen of mine, three at the least, that have

speaker: ABERGAVENNY
text_entry: By this so sickened their estates, that never

speaker: ABERGAVENNY
text_entry: They shall abound as formerly.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: O, many

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Have broke their backs with laying manors on 'em

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: For this great journey. What did this vanity

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: But minister communication of

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: A most poor issue?

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Grievingly I think,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: The peace between the French and us not values

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: The cost that did conclude it.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Every man,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: After the hideous storm that follow'd, was

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: A thing inspired; and, not consulting, broke

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Into a general prophecy; That this tempest,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Dashing the garment of this peace, aboded

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: The sudden breach on't.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Which is budded out;

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: For France hath flaw'd the league, and hath attach'd

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Our merchants' goods at Bourdeaux.

speaker: ABERGAVENNY
text_entry: Is it therefore

speaker: ABERGAVENNY
text_entry: The ambassador is silenced?

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Marry, is't.

speaker: ABERGAVENNY
text_entry: A proper title of a peace; and purchased

speaker: ABERGAVENNY
text_entry: At a superfluous rate!

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Why, all this business

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Our reverend cardinal carried.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Like it your grace,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: The state takes notice of the private difference

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Betwixt you and the cardinal. I advise you--

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: And take it from a heart that wishes towards you

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Honour and plenteous safety--that you read

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: The cardinal's malice and his potency

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Together; to consider further that

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: What his high hatred would effect wants not

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: A minister in his power. You know his nature,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: That he's revengeful, and I know his sword

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Hath a sharp edge: it's long and, 't may be said,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: It reaches far, and where 'twill not extend,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Thither he darts it. Bosom up my counsel,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: You'll find it wholesome. Lo, where comes that rock

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: That I advise your shunning.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Enter CARDINAL WOLSEY, the purse borne before him,  certain of the Guard, and two Secretaries with  papers. CARDINAL WOLSEY in his passage fixeth his  eye on BUCKINGHAM, and BUCKINGHAM on him, both full of disdain

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: The Duke of Buckingham's surveyor, ha?

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Where's his examination?

speaker: First Secretary
text_entry: Here, so please you.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Is he in person ready?

speaker: First Secretary
text_entry: Ay, please your grace.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Well, we shall then know more; and Buckingham

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Shall lessen this big look.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Exeunt CARDINAL WOLSEY and his Train

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: This butcher's cur is venom-mouth'd, and I

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Have not the power to muzzle him; therefore best

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Not wake him in his slumber. A beggar's book

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Outworths a noble's blood.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: What, are you chafed?

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Ask God for temperance; that's the appliance only

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Which your disease requires.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: I read in's looks

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Matter against me; and his eye reviled

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Me, as his abject object: at this instant

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: He bores me with some trick: he's gone to the king;

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: I'll follow and outstare him.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Stay, my lord,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: And let your reason with your choler question

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: What 'tis you go about: to climb steep hills

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Requires slow pace at first: anger is like

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: A full-hot horse, who being allow'd his way,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Self-mettle tires him. Not a man in England

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Can advise me like you: be to yourself

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: As you would to your friend.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: I'll to the king;

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: And from a mouth of honour quite cry down

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: This Ipswich fellow's insolence; or proclaim

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: There's difference in no persons.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Be advised;

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Heat not a furnace for your foe so hot

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: That it do singe yourself: we may outrun,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: By violent swiftness, that which we run at,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: And lose by over-running. Know you not,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: The fire that mounts the liquor til run o'er,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: In seeming to augment it wastes it? Be advised:

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: I say again, there is no English soul

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: More stronger to direct you than yourself,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: If with the sap of reason you would quench,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Or but allay, the fire of passion.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Sir,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: I am thankful to you; and I'll go along

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: By your prescription: but this top-proud fellow,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Whom from the flow of gall I name not but

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: From sincere motions, by intelligence,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: And proofs as clear as founts in July when

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: We see each grain of gravel, I do know

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: To be corrupt and treasonous.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Say not 'treasonous.'

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: To the king I'll say't; and make my vouch as strong

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: As shore of rock. Attend. This holy fox,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Or wolf, or both,--for he is equal ravenous

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: As he is subtle, and as prone to mischief

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: As able to perform't; his mind and place

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Infecting one another, yea, reciprocally--

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Only to show his pomp as well in France

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: As here at home, suggests the king our master

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: To this last costly treaty, the interview,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: That swallow'd so much treasure, and like a glass

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Did break i' the rinsing.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Faith, and so it did.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Pray, give me favour, sir. This cunning cardinal

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: The articles o' the combination drew

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: As himself pleased; and they were ratified

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: As he cried 'Thus let be': to as much end

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: As give a crutch to the dead: but our count-cardinal

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Has done this, and 'tis well; for worthy Wolsey,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Who cannot err, he did it. Now this follows,--

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Which, as I take it, is a kind of puppy

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: To the old dam, treason,--Charles the emperor,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Under pretence to see the queen his aunt--

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: For 'twas indeed his colour, but he came

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: To whisper Wolsey,--here makes visitation:

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: His fears were, that the interview betwixt

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: England and France might, through their amity,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Breed him some prejudice; for from this league

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Peep'd harms that menaced him: he privily

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Deals with our cardinal; and, as I trow,--

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Which I do well; for I am sure the emperor

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Paid ere he promised; whereby his suit was granted

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Ere it was ask'd; but when the way was made,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: And paved with gold, the emperor thus desired,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: That he would please to alter the king's course,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: And break the foresaid peace. Let the king know,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: As soon he shall by me, that thus the cardinal

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Does buy and sell his honour as he pleases,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: And for his own advantage.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: I am sorry

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: To hear this of him; and could wish he were

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Something mistaken in't.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: No, not a syllable:

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: I  do pronounce him in that very shape

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: He shall appear in proof.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Enter BRANDON, a Sergeant-at-arms before him, and two or three of the Guard

speaker: BRANDON
text_entry: Your office, sergeant; execute it.

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: Sir,

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: My lord the Duke of Buckingham, and Earl

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: Of Hereford, Stafford, and Northampton, I

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: Arrest thee of high treason, in the name

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: Of our most sovereign king.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Lo, you, my lord,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: The net has fall'n upon me! I shall perish

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Under device and practise.

speaker: BRANDON
text_entry: I am sorry

speaker: BRANDON
text_entry: To see you ta'en from liberty, to look on

speaker: BRANDON
text_entry: The business present: 'tis his highness' pleasure

speaker: BRANDON
text_entry: You shall to the Tower.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: It will help me nothing

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: To plead mine innocence; for that dye is on me

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Which makes my whitest part black. The will of heaven

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Be done in this and all things! I obey.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: O my Lord Abergavenny, fare you well!

speaker: BRANDON
text_entry: Nay, he must bear you company. The king

speaker: BRANDON
text_entry: To ABERGAVENNY

speaker: BRANDON
text_entry: Is pleased you shall to the Tower, till you know

speaker: BRANDON
text_entry: How he determines further.

speaker: ABERGAVENNY
text_entry: As the duke said,

speaker: ABERGAVENNY
text_entry: The will of heaven be done, and the king's pleasure

speaker: ABERGAVENNY
text_entry: By me obey'd!

speaker: BRANDON
text_entry: Here is a warrant from

speaker: BRANDON
text_entry: The king to attach Lord Montacute; and the bodies

speaker: BRANDON
text_entry: Of the duke's confessor, John de la Car,

speaker: BRANDON
text_entry: One Gilbert Peck, his chancellor--

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: So, so;

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: These are the limbs o' the plot: no more, I hope.

speaker: BRANDON
text_entry: A monk o' the Chartreux.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: O, Nicholas Hopkins?

speaker: BRANDON
text_entry: He.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: My surveyor is false; the o'er-great cardinal

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Hath show'd him gold; my life is spann'd already:

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: I am the shadow of poor Buckingham,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Whose figure even this instant cloud puts on,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: By darkening my clear sun. My lord, farewell.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Exeunt
